casebody.data:
Bakos, Appellee, v. Insura Property & Casualty Insurance Company et al., Appellants.

[Cite as Bakos v. Insura Prop. & Cas. Ins. Co. (1998), 84 Ohio St.3d 1219.]

(No. 97-2431 Submitted October 28, 1998 Decided December 30, 1998.) Peterson & Zelasko and Bradford D. Zelasko, for appellee. McNeal, Schick, Archibald & Biro Co., L.P.A., and Paul W. Ziegler, for appellant Insura Property & Casualty Insurance Company. *1220Weston Hurd Fallon Paisley & Howley L.L.P., John G. Faman, Hilary S. Taylor and William H. Baughman, Jr., for appellant St. Paul Fire & Marine Insurance Company.

The cause is dismissed for want of conflict within the meaning of S.Ct.Prac.R. rV(2)(B).

Moyer, C.J., Douglas, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur. Cook, J., dissents. Cook, J.,

dissenting. I respectfully dissent from the decision to dismiss this case as improvidently certified and, if addressing this case on the merits, would affirm the decision of the court of appeals.
